title: Heineken Share the Good
content:
Anyone know the fonts used for this campaign? I thought one was Waverly at first but it definitely isn’t. I’m wondering what both of them are if anyone can help.

thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011005841im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/shareGood_6153.gif)

 [‹ Crate & Barrel](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011005841/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46407 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help Identifying Font! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011005841/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46400 "Go to next forum topic")
author: efthomas

comments.content:
Similar to “Share/Good” but not an exact match:

Everafter, from TypeTrust  
 [http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTY4&fontview=specimen](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011005841/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTY4&fontview=specimen "http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MTY4&fontview=specimen")

It’s Heineken Serif, designed by Lucas de Groot.  
 [http://users.ncrvnet.nl/mstol/heineken.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011005841/http:/users.ncrvnet.nl/mstol/heineken.html)

and you can get a free font adaptation of heineken logo here:  
 [http://www.fonts4free.net/heineken-font.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011005841/http:/www.fonts4free.net/heineken-font.html "http://www.fonts4free.net/heineken-font.html")

not exactly the same with degroot’s, but hey, its free.

dr

and you can get a free font adaptation of heineken logo here:  
 [http://www.fonts4free.net/heineken-font.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011005841/http:/www.fonts4free.net/heineken-font.html "http://www.fonts4free.net/heineken-font.html")

not exactly the same with degroot’s, but hey, its free.  
——————————-

I’m sure Mr. de Groot will be happy you posted that. Unless he wanted to eat, or something

Jason C
Jason, it’s not that the official quality version of Heineken was generally available for licensing via LucasFonts, is it?
There’s a font on dafont.com called Heineken that looks like “Share/Good.” And I’ve seen a font called Spoleto that looks a lot like the “the.”
